message._content: When i click on this link: www.flickr.com/services/oauth/request_token?oauth_callbac... the debug message says: oauth_problem=signature_invalid&debug_sbs=GET&https%3A%2F%2Fwww.flickr.com%2Fservices%2Foauth%2Frequest_token&oauth_callback%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fwww.markriemann.com%252Fflickr%26oauth_consumer_key%3Dec61d7a4be3e3814b4b4baca653c8a45%26oauth_nonce%3D0462df92491c433cbc0711ad41b73ae6%26oauth_signature_method%3DHMAC-SHA1%26oauth_timestamp%3D1404850686%26oauth_version%3D1.0 I believe my signature was done correctly. Key was my app secret + "&" and the basestring was GET&https%3A%2F%2Fwww.flickr.com%2Fservices%2Foauth%2Frequest_token&oauth_callback%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fwww.markriemann.com%252Fflickr%26oauth_consumer_key%3Dec61d7a4be3e3814b4b4baca653c8a45%26oauth_nonce%3D0462df92491c433cbc0711ad41b73ae6%26oauth_signature_method%3DHMAC-SHA1%26oauth_timestamp%3D1404850686%26oauth_version%3D1.0 So what am I missing? Thanks, Mark

topic.subject: flickr4java - unable to obtain DELETE permission

message._content:
I'm using flickr4java v2.8 in my application that downloads photos.

I can authenticate successfully, and get lists of my photo albums etc., but am getting:

com.flickr4java.flickr.FlickrException: 99: Insufficient permissions. Method requires read privileges; none granted.

when attempting to download photos. I have set 

authInterface.getAuthorizationUrl(rtoken, Permission.DELETE);

(I need access to delete photos as well as download them) which I assumed also allows read and write access, as well as delete.

Should I instead by ORing all Permissions I need together?

Thanks for any advice!

topic.author: 10385775@N00

message._content: Hey everyone, I want to access metadata of photos and created a bbox, splitted this bbox into several smaller bboxes and want to download the metadata of the photos now. On the API documentation site it says the following: Geo queries require some sort of limiting agent in order to prevent the database from crying. This is basically like the check against "parameterless searches" for queries without a geo component. A tag, for instance, is considered a limiting agent as are user defined min_date_taken and min_date_upload parameters — If no limiting factor is passed we return only photos added in the last 12 hours (though we may extend the limit in the future). www.flickr.com/services/api/flickr.photos.search.html My bboxes are very small which should prevent the database from crying. Do I still need a limiting agent? Adding a limiter will narrow my search... I do not want to limit my search by anything since I want to access all the photos in that bbox, does not matter which date, tag, etc. they have.

topic.author: 116733588@N08

topic.subject: How many request to API possible?

message._content:
Hey there,
I have created a REST API request with a bbox. I split that bbox in smaller bboxes to cover the whole area (cause one can only download 4000 metadatas per request) and will download per bbox all 4000 metadatas (at least I have a request to do that, but there wont be 4000 Metadatas per bbox). However, that will be a looot of request.
I am not good with math but I think that might be 1Mio requests, done one after another. 

Will the REST API allow that or do I have to set a timer to get the information (only 1 request per second or something like that).

Thanks for your answeres.
Chris

topic.author: 125453919@N02

topic.subject: flickr.photos.search - prevent search results including photos where download = disabled

message._content: Hi, I am doing some basic work on the flickr.photos.search API. I've been looking at the readme: www.flickr.com/services/api/flickr.photos.search.html I can't work out how to add in a parameter to the API to stop photos appearing which owners have set to not be downloaded. For example, this photo was returned in my API search for "goofy": www.flickr.com/photos/paintthemoon/4500692698/sizes/l/ But it says on the photo page: The owner has disabled downloading of their photos Therefore when I try to embed the photo in my pages, I get directed to this photo: s.yimg.com/pw/images/photo_unavailable.gif It'd be good if I could just ask the API to not include search results where the owner has disabled downloading. Is that possible? Thanks
